name: Dream.Org
mission: At Dream.org we close prison doors and open doors of opportunity into the green economy. We bring people together across racial, social, and partisan lines to create a future with freedom, dignity, and opportunity for all.
theoryOfChange: The site states that lasting change requires a broad coalition, working with anyone willing to be part of the solution across divides to create durable solutions created by lots of people together, including ending mass incarceration, stopping climate change, and creating new economic opportunities in overlooked communities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://dream.org/give/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 20/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: Expenses ($74,009,967) exceed revenue ($4,091,131) by 1709% - may be drawing down reserves

score_details.score_summary: Dream.Org shows good impact and moderate alignment.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://dream.org/give/)

all_citations.claim: Dream.Org focuses on closing prison doors and opening green economy opportunities through its three core programs.
The organization works to bring people together across racial and partisan lines to address environmental and social issues.
Dream.Org operates specific programs including Dream Tech and Innovation and Dream Green For All.
The organization accepts general donations and Sadaqah-eligible contributions.
Dream.Org holds a 97.75/100 score and has a high cost per beneficiary due to its advocacy-based model.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,091,131 and holds 4.8 months of working capital with a fundraising efficiency of $0.36 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Dream.Org earns a moderate overall score due to its high organizational transparency and accountability, balanced against a lower alignment for donors seeking traditional religious charitable frameworks.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary relative to direct-service organizations
Limited alignment with specific Muslim donor priorities or religious frameworks

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the organization addresses urgent social and environmental issues, it has a low donor fit for those seeking specific Muslim-led initiatives [7]. Contributions are categorized as Sadaqah-eligible, supporting general charitable efforts rather than Zakat-specific pathways [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to systemic change through advocacy and capacity building, though its cost per beneficiary is calculated at 17806.442 [7]. Financially, the charity reported a total revenue of $4,091,131 and holds 4.8 months of working capital [8].

baseline_narrative.headline: Dream.Org works to close prison doors and open opportunities within the emerging green economy through cross-partisan advocacy and innovation.
strengths: High Charity Navigator score of 97.75/100 for accountability and finance
Strong focus on bipartisan coalition building and capacity building
Transparent organizational data and clear programmatic structure
baseline_narrative.summary: Dream.Org is a nonprofit organization dedicated to criminal justice reform and environmental equity by bridging racial and social divides [1][2]. The organization operates three primary programs: Dream Tech and Innovation, Dream Green For All, and Dream Justice [1][3].

all_citations.quote: Dream.Org works to close prison doors and open opportunities within the emerging green economy through cross-partisan advocacy and innovation.

all_citations.claim: Dream Tech, Dream Green, and Dream Justice
all_citations.quote: We pursue this through three dynamic programs: Dream Tech, Dream Green, and Dream Justice.

all_citations.claim: awareness for $369 billion in federal climate funding

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Dream.Org earns a moderate overall score due to its high organizational transparency and accountability, balanced against a lower alignment for donors seeking traditional religious charitable frameworks.

areas_for_improvement.detail: As an advocacy-focused entity, the organization has a <cite id="7">high cost per beneficiary of $17,806.44</cite>, which may be less appealing to donors seeking high-volume direct service.
The organization has experienced a <cite id="8">3-year revenue CAGR of -73.4%</cite>, indicating a need for more stable, diversified long-term funding streams.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high standards of governance and financial accountability as evidenced by Charity Navigator and Candid ratings.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high working capital to buffer against revenue fluctuations.

data_gaps: Employee count not specified in 990 summary
confidence.notes: Strong third-party ratings provide high confidence in governance data.

known_gaps: High officer compensation relative to 2023 revenue

alignment.explanation: The charity is <cite id="8">SADAQAH-ELIGIBLE</cite> but lacks specific Muslim donor alignment signals or religious frameworks in its programming.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="7">clearly stating how its justice work intersects</cite> with Islamic values of equity and stewardship.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="7">97.97.75/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>. Governance is robust, with an <cite id="7">85% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could <cite id="7">seek external evaluations</cite> to validate its long-term policy outcomes.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by systemic advocacy, though the <cite id="8">program expense ratio is 85.1%</cite> and the <cite id="7">cost per beneficiary is $17,806.44</cite>.
impact.improvement: The organization should aim to <cite id="7">track outcomes over at least three years</cite> to better demonstrate the ROI of its capacity-building model.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcome tracking via Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports local environmental and justice organizations to build community capacity.

rich_narrative.headline: Dream.Org works to close prison doors and open opportunities within the emerging green economy through cross-partisan advocacy and innovation.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize systemic bipartisan advocacy and want to invest in the intersection of climate justice and criminal justice reform.
donor_motivations: Value cross-partisan solutions to social issues
Believe in economic opportunity as a deterrent to recidivism
Prefer funding policy change over direct service delivery
Want to support organizations with high transparency ratings
giving_considerations: Donations support long-term advocacy which may take years to show results
The organization has seen recent significant revenue contraction
High overhead is typical for specialized advocacy and capacity building
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those who prefer high-efficiency direct aid with low cost-per-beneficiary metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent outcome tracking of 19 metrics via Candid, but a lack of independent third-party evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Dream.Org creates impact by mobilizing bipartisan coalitions to influence federal funding and state-level justice policies.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in advocacy ensures that policy wins actually translate to improved lives for marginalized communities.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Significant revenue decline suggests a high need for new funding to maintain advocacy momentum.
strategic_priorities: Expand Green For All toolkit reach

peer_comparison.differentiator: Unique focus on the <cite id="1">intersection of green economy and prison reform</cite> through bipartisan coalitions.

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="7">perfect 97/100 score for Accountability & Finance</cite> from Charity Navigator and a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> from Candid.
Dream.Org maintains a <cite id="7">clear theory of change</cite> and tracks <cite id="7">19 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid to measure systemic impact.
The charity demonstrates high efficiency in resource mobilization, spending only <cite id="7">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: Dream.Org excels in organizational governance and leadership, evidenced by its <cite id="7">97/100 scores in Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons. This internal strength supports its complex advocacy work, which includes <cite id="8">grantmaking to local partners</cite> like the HBCU Green Fund and Southwest Detroit Environmental Vision. Their financial resilience is underscored by a <cite id="7">working capital ratio of 4.8 months</cite>, allowing the organization to navigate the multi-year timelines inherent in legislative and environmental advocacy.
rich_narrative.summary: Dream.Org is a national nonprofit organization dedicated to closing prison doors and opening opportunities within the emerging green economy through <cite id="1">cross-partisan advocacy and innovation</cite>. The organization operates through three primary pillars: <cite id="2">Dream Tech, Dream Green, and Dream Justice</cite>, focusing on systemic change rather than direct service. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="8">total revenue of $4,091,131</cite>, representing a significant shift in its financial profile with a <cite id="8">3-year revenue CAGR of -73.4%</cite>. Despite this volatility, Dream.Org maintains <cite id="7">a 97.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting exceptional standards of accountability and finance. Their work is characterized by <cite id="2">bipartisan coalition building</cite>, aiming to ensure that the transition to a green economy includes those most impacted by mass incarceration. The organization leverages its <cite id="7">4.8 months of working capital</cite> to sustain long-term policy campaigns, such as raising <cite id="4">awareness for $369 billion in federal climate funding</cite> to ensure it reaches marginalized communities.
